trial_identification.studytitle: How androgens exert their anabolic effects: effects of oral testosterone on protein metabolism in healthy men.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: How androgens exert their anabolic effects. Effects of oral testosterone on protein metabolism in healthy men.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal metabolism and endocrine development and function

interventions.interventions: Oral micronised testosterone 40 mg daily for 14 days. Adherence to treatment will be monitored by drug return.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Protein turnover by using stable isotopes (leucine)

trial_design.statisticalmethods: Anova. Sample size has been derived from previously published studies in hypogonadal men and postmenopausal women, where similar dose of oral testosterone significantly modified protein turnover. Extrapolating from these studies with power of 80% a sample size of at least 8 will give p<0.05.

fundingsource.fundingaddress: National Health and Medical Research Council GPO Box 1421 Canberra ACT 2601

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Observations from previous studies suggest that testosterone acts on liver to induce protein anabolic effect. We will test the hypothesis that testosterone by acting on the liver, preserves protein loss in healthy men.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Western Sydney Local Health District HREC
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: WSLHD, Westmead Hospital, Darcy Rd Westmead, NSW 2145
